Comment 7: 
It looks quite brittle, though.  It feels like there's memory corruption going on.  I
feel bad because, to be honest, this may actually be my fault, due to my workaround for
bug 451 somehow.

Removing it, the crash goes away, but then the code path also changes completely since
there are other breaks and tests which aren't run.  To avoid wasting our time, I'll stop
debugging this now and will hold off until there's an agreeable fix.

Once 451 gets fixed, if it turns out to be a real problem in Go, I'll debug further.
